briefdescription.para: do not print the header information line

xrefdescription.para: This mode is not supported anymore!

briefdescription.para: Flag for vrna_constraints_add() to indicate that constraint is passed in pseudo dot-bracket notation.
Switch for dot-bracket structure constraint to enforce base pairs.

detaileddescription.para: This flag should be used to really enforce base pairs given in dot-bracket constraint rather than just weakly-enforcing them.

briefdescription.para: Flag that is used to indicate the pipe '|' sign in pseudo dot-bracket notation of hard constraints.

detaileddescription.para: Use this definition to indicate the pipe sign '|' (paired with another base)

briefdescription.para: dot '.' switch for structure constraints (no constraint at all)
'x' switch for structure constraint (base must not pair)
angle brackets '<', '>' switch for structure constraint (paired downstream/upstream)
round brackets '(',')' switch for structure constraint (base i pairs base j)
Flag that is used to indicate the character 'l' in pseudo dot-bracket notation of hard constraints.

detaileddescription.para: Use this definition to indicate the usage of 'l' character (intramolecular pairs only)

briefdescription.para: Flag that is used to indicate the character 'e' in pseudo dot-bracket notation of hard constraints.

detaileddescription.para: Use this definition to indicate the usage of 'e' character (intermolecular pairs only)

briefdescription.para: '+' switch for structure constraint (base is involved in a gquad)

simplesect.para: This flag is for future purposes only! No implementation recognizes it yet.

briefdescription.para: Flag to indicate Washington University Secondary Structure (WUSS) notation of the hard constraint string.

detaileddescription.para: This secondary structure notation for RNAs is usually used as consensus secondary structure (SS_cons) entry in Stockholm formatted files

memberdef.name: VRNA_CONSTRAINT_DB_DEFAULT
memberdef.initializer: (VRNA_CONSTRAINT_DB \ | VRNA_CONSTRAINT_DB_PIPE \ | VRNA_CONSTRAINT_DB_DOT \ | VRNA_CONSTRAINT_DB_X \ | VRNA_CONSTRAINT_DB_ANG_BRACK \ | VRNA_CONSTRAINT_DB_RND_BRACK \ | VRNA_CONSTRAINT_DB_INTRAMOL \ | VRNA_CONSTRAINT_DB_INTERMOL \ | VRNA_CONSTRAINT_DB_GQUAD \ )

briefdescription.para: Switch for dot-bracket structure constraint with default symbols.

detaileddescription.para: This flag conveniently combines all possible symbols in dot-bracket notation for hard constraints and VRNA_CONSTRAINT_DB

briefdescription.para: Hard constraints flag, base pair in the exterior loop.
Hard constraints flag, base pair encloses hairpin loop.
Hard constraints flag, base pair encloses an interior loop.
Hard constraints flag, base pair encloses a multi branch loop.
Hard constraints flag, base pair is enclosed in an interior loop.
Hard constraints flag, base pair is enclosed in a multi branch loop.
Hard constraint flag to indicate enforcement of constraints.
Hard constraint flag to indicate not to remove base pairs that conflict with a given constraint.
Constraint context flag that forbids a nucleotide or base pair to appear in any loop.
Constraint context flag indicating base pairs that close any loop.
Constraint context flag indicating base pairs enclosed by any loop.
Constraint context flag indicating any loop context.
Default Hard Constraints.
Hard Constraints suitable for local structure prediction using window approach.
The hard constraints type.

detaileddescription.para: Global and local structure prediction methods use a slightly different way to handle hard constraints internally. This enum is used to distinguish both types.

briefdescription.para: Typename for the hard constraints data structure vrna_hc_s.
Typename for the single nucleotide hard constraint data structure vrna_hc_up_s.

memberdef.definition: typedef unsigned char(* vrna_hc_eval_f) (int i, int j, int k, int l, unsigned char d, void *data)
memberdef.argsstring: )(int i, int j, int k, int l, unsigned char d, void *data)
memberdef.name: vrna_hc_eval_f

briefdescription.para: Callback to evaluate whether or not a particular decomposition step is contributing to the solution space.

detaileddescription.para: This is the prototype for callback functions used by the folding recursions to evaluate generic hard constraints. The first four parameters passed indicate the delimiting nucleotide positions of the decomposition, and the parameter denotes the decomposition step. The last parameter data is the auxiliary data structure associated to the hard constraints via vrna_hc_add_data(), or NULL if no auxiliary data was added.

parblock.para: This callback enables one to over-rule default hard constraints in secondary structure decompositions.

simplesect.para: VRNA_DECOMP_PAIR_HP, VRNA_DECOMP_PAIR_IL, VRNA_DECOMP_PAIR_ML, VRNA_DECOMP_ML_ML_ML, VRNA_DECOMP_ML_STEM, VRNA_DECOMP_ML_ML, VRNA_DECOMP_ML_UP, VRNA_DECOMP_ML_ML_STEM, VRNA_DECOMP_ML_COAXIAL, VRNA_DECOMP_EXT_EXT, VRNA_DECOMP_EXT_UP, VRNA_DECOMP_EXT_STEM, VRNA_DECOMP_EXT_EXT_EXT, VRNA_DECOMP_EXT_STEM_EXT, VRNA_DECOMP_EXT_EXT_STEM, VRNA_DECOMP_EXT_EXT_STEM1, vrna_hc_add_f(), vrna_hc_add_data()

parameterdescription.para: Left (5') delimiter position of substructure
Right (3') delimiter position of substructure
Left delimiter of decomposition
Right delimiter of decomposition
Decomposition step indicator
Auxiliary data

simplesect.para: A non-zero value if the decomposition is valid, 0 otherwise

memberdef.definition: typedef unsigned char() vrna_callback_hc_evaluate(int i, int j, int k, int l, unsigned char d, void *data)
memberdef.argsstring: (int i, int j, int k, int l, unsigned char d, void *data)
memberdef.name: vrna_callback_hc_evaluate

briefdescription.para: Print a help message for pseudo dot-bracket structure constraint characters to stdout. (constraint support is specified by option parameter)

detaileddescription.para: Currently available options are: VRNA_CONSTRAINT_DB_PIPE (paired with another base) VRNA_CONSTRAINT_DB_DOT (no constraint at all) VRNA_CONSTRAINT_DB_X (base must not pair) VRNA_CONSTRAINT_DB_ANG_BRACK (paired downstream/upstream) VRNA_CONSTRAINT_DB_RND_BRACK (base i pairs base j) pass a collection of options as one value like this: vrna_message_constraints(option_1 | option_2 | option_n)

simplesect.para: vrna_message_constraint_options_all(), vrna_constraints_add(), VRNA_CONSTRAINT_DB, VRNA_CONSTRAINT_DB_PIPE, VRNA_CONSTRAINT_DB_DOT, VRNA_CONSTRAINT_DB_X, VRNA_CONSTRAINT_DB_ANG_BRACK, VRNA_CONSTRAINT_DB_RND_BRACK, VRNA_CONSTRAINT_DB_INTERMOL, VRNA_CONSTRAINT_DB_INTRAMOL

parameterdescription.para: Option switch that tells which constraint help will be printed

briefdescription.para: Print structure constraint characters to stdout (full constraint support)

simplesect.para: vrna_message_constraint_options(), vrna_constraints_add(), VRNA_CONSTRAINT_DB, VRNA_CONSTRAINT_DB_PIPE, VRNA_CONSTRAINT_DB_DOT, VRNA_CONSTRAINT_DB_X, VRNA_CONSTRAINT_DB_ANG_BRACK, VRNA_CONSTRAINT_DB_RND_BRACK, VRNA_CONSTRAINT_DB_INTERMOL, VRNA_CONSTRAINT_DB_INTRAMOL

briefdescription.para: Initialize/Reset hard constraints to default values.

detaileddescription.para: This function resets the hard constraints to their default values, i.e. all positions may be unpaired in all contexts, and base pairs are allowed in all contexts, if they resemble canonical pairs. Previously set hard constraints will be removed before initialization.

parameterdescription.para: The fold compound

parblock.para: This function is attached as method hc_init() to objects of type fold_compound. See, e.g. embed:rst:inline :py:meth:`RNA.fold_compound.hc_init()` in the :doc:`/api_python` .

memberdef.argsstring: (vrna_fold_compound_t *fc, unsigned int i, unsigned int options)
memberdef.name: vrna_hc_update

briefdescription.para: Make a certain nucleotide unpaired.

The position that needs to stay unpaired (1-based)
The options flag indicating how/where to store the hard constraints

briefdescription.para: Enforce a nucleotide to be paired (upstream/downstream)

simplesect.para: vrna_hc_add_bp(), vrna_hc_add_up(), vrna_hc_init(), VRNA_CONSTRAINT_CONTEXT_EXT_LOOP, VRNA_CONSTRAINT_CONTEXT_HP_LOOP, VRNA_CONSTRAINT_CONTEXT_INT_LOOP, VRNA_CONSTRAINT_CONTEXT_INT_LOOP_ENC, VRNA_CONSTRAINT_CONTEXT_MB_LOOP, VRNA_CONSTRAINT_CONTEXT_MB_LOOP_ENC, VRNA_CONSTRAINT_CONTEXT_ALL_LOOPS

parameterdescription.para: The vrna_fold_compound_t the hard constraints are associated with
The position that needs to stay unpaired (1-based)
The direction of base pairing ( $ d < 0 $: pairs upstream, $ d > 0 $: pairs downstream, $ d == 0 $: no direction)
The options flag indicating in which loop type context the pairs may appear

briefdescription.para: Free the memory allocated by a vrna_hc_t data structure.

detaileddescription.para: Use this function to free all memory that was allocated for a data structure of type vrna_hc_t .

briefdescription.para: Add a function pointer pointer for the generic hard constraint feature.
Add an auxiliary data structure for the generic hard constraints callback function.

parameterdescription.para: The fold compound the generic hard constraint function should be bound to
A pointer to the data structure that holds required data for function 'f'
A pointer to a function that free's the memory occupied by data (Maybe NULL)

briefdescription.para: Add hard constraints from pseudo dot-bracket notation.

detaileddescription.para: This function allows one to apply hard constraints from a pseudo dot-bracket notation. The options parameter controls, which characters are recognized by the parser. Use the VRNA_CONSTRAINT_DB_DEFAULT convenience macro, if you want to allow all known characters

simplesect.para: VRNA_CONSTRAINT_DB_PIPE, VRNA_CONSTRAINT_DB_DOT, VRNA_CONSTRAINT_DB_X, VRNA_CONSTRAINT_DB_ANG_BRACK, VRNA_CONSTRAINT_DB_RND_BRACK, VRNA_CONSTRAINT_DB_INTRAMOL, VRNA_CONSTRAINT_DB_INTERMOL, VRNA_CONSTRAINT_DB_GQUAD

parameterdescription.para: The fold compound
A pseudo dot-bracket notation of the hard constraint.
The option flags

briefdescription.para: Insert constraining pair types according to constraint structure string.

xrefdescription.para: Do not use this function anymore! Structure constraints are now handled through vrna_hc_t and related functions.

parameterdescription.para: The structure constraint string
The actual length of the sequence (constraint may be shorter)
A pointer to the basepair type array
(not used anymore)
The minimal loop size (usually TURN )
Define the access type for base pair type array (0 = indx, 1 = iindx)

briefdescription.para: Functions and data structures for handling of secondary structure hard constraints.
